snippet: Even though regulators are required by the new health care law to review requests for a large rate increases, many states have not given the overseers any authority to deny or roll back rates that are deemed excessive.
abstract: Health insurance companies across country are seeking and winning double-digit increases in premiums for some customers; those being impacted in particular are small businesses and people who do not have employer-provided insurance and must buy it on their own; situation is emerging because many states have not given regulators authority to deny or roll back rates that are deemed excessive.
lead_paragraph: Even though regulators are required by the new health care law to review requests for a large rate increases, many states have not given the overseers any authority to deny or roll back rates that are deemed excessive.

headline.seo: Despite New Health Law, Some See Sharp Rise in Premiums
headline.main: Health Insurers Raise Some Rates by Double Digits
headline.print_headline: Health Insurers Raise Some Rates By Double Digits

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
